page.title: 10TOURISM
page.content: Kendal is known as the{Gateway to the {Lakes.}People who are staying in the Lake District come into Kendal, as it is the main shopping centre. Not many people stay in Kendal, but lots of people visit it. Hotels include the {County, Woolpack, Gateway,}and a number of guest houses. Most people come to see places of interest such as {Abbot Hall, the Museum of Lakeland {Life and Industry, and the castle.}In September there is the{Kendal {Gathering}which includes a{Torchlight {Procession,}concerts, and other events which extend the tourist season into September. Holidays in UK have become more popular since the foreign exchange rate became unfavourable and local trade has grown as{"mini-breaks" at off peak times gain popularity especially with retired people who enjoy a quiet, rural holiday.
